# Extendicare## PROCEDURE**MANUAL:** Infection Prevention and Control
**INDEX:** IPC6-P10.06
**SECTION:** Multi-Drug Resistant Organisms (MDROs)
**DESCRIPTION:** Candida auris
**EFFECTIVE DATE:** February 18, 2025
**REVIEWED DATE:** February 11, 2025
**APPROVED BY:** Chief Medical Officer
**MODIFIED DATE:** May 30, 2025----## POLICY### Multi-Drug Resistant Organisms (MDROs)## PROCEDURE### Surveillance and Reporting- Ensure that, prior to admission, the completed application has been reviewed for any history of C. auris and forwarded to the Infection Control Professional/Designate if there is history of infection, colonization or exposure. - Assess all residents who meet the following Candida auris (C. auris) risk criteria:
- Have had recent surgeries;
- Are diabetic;
- Use broad-spectrum antibiotics and antifungals;
- Have invasive medical devices such as breathing tubes, feeding tubes, and central venous catheters; and/or
- Have frequent stays in health care settings (i.e., particularly in long-term acute care hospitals, and long-term care homes that provide ventilator care).### Precautions- If it is determined that a resident may have a C.

- Ensure twice-daily cleaning/disinfecting for resident rooms with suspected/confirmed C. auris with an appropriate chemical.----**Helping People**
